meanings.definition: To trim off the outer covering or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: She pared the apple with a knife.
meanings.sent2: He carefully pared the excess fat from the meat.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully pared the vegetables into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor pared away at the marble block to reveal the hidden figure within.
meanings.sent5: With precision, she pared the rough edges of the wood to create a smooth finish.

meanings.definition: To reduce something in size, amount, or extent.
meanings.sent1: The company pared down its workforce to save costs.
meanings.sent2: She pared her wardrobe to only essential items.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to pare the giant balloon into a tiny one.
meanings.sent4: As time passed, the old building was pared down to just a few walls.
meanings.sent5: The budget cuts pared the project to its core elements, making it more efficient.
